instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.CD3127: What is CD3127? This is a common typo,  the person typing CD3127 was most likely referring to a CD3217.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message:
First was 3 usb ports acting 5v 200mah and 1 port only 5v 36mah, i changed 2 usb controllers one side and now 4 acting 5v 200mah, without battery connected. When i connect battery after first try ports same 5v 200mah but second try with battery 20v 0.63mah steady. 

ppbus 12.30 cycling to 10-11, like trying to get 12.60

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message:
Some people reported on Internet to have problems aquiring good <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips for this model.
Seems that doesn't accept any chip, like other models.

Are you using 96/140W charger?
Any history fault available?
What voltage do you get on the coils, with both charger and battery connected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message: Now its booting and working, but something is wrong with left side because no usb activity, but right side is working and not charging

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message:
Machine works with charger connected on left side too?
Just no USB activity there (J3300)?

Check <CAPACITOR>C3506</CAPACITOR>/3298 voltage, when connect an USB device (not charger) on that side.

USB-C metter switches to 20V on all ports, without battery connected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message: usb c meter not switching to 20v without battery, when battery connected 20v 36mah, without battery 5v 230-250mah. board boots fine and working but no charging and left side activity

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message:
Which <CHIP>CD3127</CHIP> chips did you change, left side?

96W charger for sure?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message: 96w charger yes. left side <CHIP>CD3127</CHIP> i changed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power issue
threads.message:
Did you check mentioned voltage, when connect USB device on left side?
That voltage comes from L3500.

All ports stuck in 5V without battery, or just left side?
